title: Limited Healthcare Access in Rural Areas
summary: The majority of Bangladesh's population lacks access to quality healthcare due to shortage of doctors, inadequate facilities, and geographic barriers.
currentSituation: Bangladesh has approximately 1 doctor per 2,000 people, well below WHO recommendations. Specialist doctors are concentrated in Dhaka and major cities. Rural health centers often lack basic equipment and qualified staff. Patients travel hours to reach quality care.
consequences: High maternal and infant mortality rates
Financial burden from travel and treatment costs
potentialTechInterventions: Health worker mobile apps for community health
Medicine delivery and inventory management systems
relatedResources: Ministry of Health Digital Health Strategy
